children.text: This dwelling is in a designated termite zone, and there is no evidence of a termite protection system being installed to protect this home from termite infestation that can cause serious damage to the structure.
Part 3.1.4.3 Termite management systems of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) requires that
‘Where a termite management system is required it must comply with AS 3660.1; and have a durable notice installed in accordance with 3.1.4.4’ .
Whereas Part 3.1.4.4 Durable notice requires that
‘A durable notice must be permanently fixed to the building in a prominent location, such as in a meter box or the like, indicating;
the termite management system used; and
the date of installation of the system; and
where a chemical is used, its life expectancy as listed on the appropriate authority’s register label; and
the installer’s or manufacturer’s recommendations for the scope and frequency of future inspections of termite activity’ .
A termite management system must be properly installed and a notice installed to indicate the termite system used, in accordance with the requirements of the BCA.
